dict.acceptation: 关系上地；相对地；比较地；较比；

sent.orig: Thus theeffective temperature range of Bb001 was relatively broad while that of Bb004 was relatively narrow.
sent.trans: 其中，Bb001有较宽的适宜温度范围，而Bb004适宜温度范围较小。

sent.orig: Before we will feel that Japanese companies will are relatively bureaucratic, relatively slow action.
sent.trans: 以前我们会觉得日本的公司会相对来说比较官僚，行动比较迟缓。

sent.orig: It has a relatively open economy and a large and relatively well-educated pool of skilled labor.
sent.trans: 泰国的经济相对开放，熟练工人数量众多，相对教育较好。

sent.orig: The relatively short (?) of mat and the relatively long (?) of mad are allophones.
sent.trans: mat中较短的？和mad中的较长的？是语音变体。

sent.orig: Milk from a an untreated cow is still relatively relatively safe to drink.
sent.trans: 牛奶产至于没有治病的牛还算比较安全。
